Key Match Events: Dereck Lively picked up his fifth foul with Daniel Gafford waiting to come in.
Jordan Clarkson converted on an and-one to go back up 111-110 with 1:33 to go.
John Collins slammed it home with 6.5 seconds to go.
Naji Marshall air-balled a shot in the final possession.
Pre-Game Insights: Without Kyrie Irving, Jason Kidd decided to shake up the starting lineup, rolling with Luka Doncic, Quentin Grimes, Klay Thompson, Maxi Kleber, and Dereck Lively II.
Grimes' start came as a small surprise given he was a DNP-Coach's Decision just two games ago.
Post-Match Reflections: Luka Doncic led all players with 37 points and nine assists, but he also turned it over three times.
Naji Marshall had a few sloppy plays in the first half but rebounded to finish with 19 points and three steals.
Klay Thompson had 17 points and three turnovers, Quentin Grimes had 15 points (all in the first half), and Daniel Gafford had 10 points.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mavericks allowed 16 offensive rebounds, turned it over 17 times, and shot just 30.8% from the free-throw line.
This was the Jazz's first home win of the season as they moved to 3-8, while the Mavericks fell to 5-7.
